Running the example ﬁrst prints the shape of the X and y components. We can see that the
X component has a three-dimensional structure. The ﬁrst dimension is the number of samples,
in this case 7. The second dimension is the number of time steps per sample, in this case 3, the
value speciﬁed to the function. Finally, the last dimension speciﬁes the number of parallel time
series or the number of variables, in this case 2 for the two parallel series. We can then see that
